Package com.GREENWORKS.eco

Class EcoMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.GREENWORKS.eco.EcoMap
  • public class EcoMap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the transference of locations data points from the database to the front end. Note: This class also checks admin credentials. It is probably the case that admin credentials should be moved to another class. However, this will done in a refactoring stage.

      EcoMap()

        public EcoMap()

    • Method Detail

      • getLocations

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLocations()
        This method returns the full list of locations stored in the database. The location data is used to plot points on the map.
        Returns:
        A complete list of locations.

      • retrieveLocations

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> retrieveLocations​(MysqlConnect mysqlConnect)
                                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method was pulled from the getLocations() method. It has been pulled to make unit testing more approachable.
        Parameters:
        mysqlConnect - Requires a MysqlConnect object for database connection.
        Returns:
        A complete list of locations.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an exception is thrown it is likely due to a misconfiguration in the DatabaseConstants.java.

      • addSlashes

        public java.lang.String addSlashes​(java.lang.String s)
        This method adds slashes to a String to preserve the backslashes in textual entries.
        Parameters:
        s - The String that will be modified.
        Returns:
        A String that has had additional backslashes added.

      • removeTags

        public java.lang.String removeTags​(java.lang.String s)
        This method removes HTML tags from a String. It removes the tags <> and what is contained within the tags.
        Parameters:
        s - The String that will be modified.
        Returns:
        A modified String that will have no HTML tags.

      • cleanInput

        public java.lang.String cleanInput​(java.lang.String s)
        This method executes the removeTags() and the addSlashes() methods consecutively.
        Parameters:
        s - The String that will be modified.
        Returns:
        A modified String that will have no HTML tags and its backslashes preserved.

      • checkLogin

        public java.lang.Boolean checkLogin​(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String password)
        This is a credentials checker. It uses the credentials that the user provides to check if they exist in the database. If the credentials exist then the method returns true. If the credentials do not exist then the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        username - The username provided by the user.
        password - The password provided by the user.
        Returns:
        Boolean check if the credentials exists or not.
